messenger2 package¶

package for launch client-server messenger¶

Subpackages¶

  • messenger2.client package
    • package for client work side
    • Subpackages
      • messenger2.client.gui package
        • Module that is used to show gui for client

    • Module contents
  • messenger2.common package
    • package that server and client use both
    • Subpackages
      • messenger2.common.security package
        • security package for encrypting and decrypting data
        • Submodules

    • Submodules

    • messenger2.common.descriptors module

    • Module contents

    • package for creating database for client and server

Submodules¶

messenger2.client_start module¶

messenger2.client_start.get_parameters(address=None, port=None, username=None, password=None)¶

get parameters from command line if there are not in line then from config file :param address: ip address :param port: port :param username: login :param password: password :return: parameters

messenger2.client_start.start(ip=None, port=None, username=None, password=None)¶

open welcome window with parameters :param ip: ip address :param port: port :param username: login :param password: password :return: None

messenger2.launcher module¶

messenger2.server_start module¶

messenger2.server_start.get_parameters(address=None, port=None)¶

get parameters from command line if there are not in line then use default in config file :param address: ip address :param port: port :return: parameters

messenger2.server_start.start(ip=None, port=None)¶

start server with ip and port :param ip: ip address :param port: port :return: None
